subject: Re: [junit] JUnit Testing Process
msgSnippet: ... The developers should either: - fix the code - fix the test ... I personally dislike when the only thing I see on the console is a AssertionFailedError
messageBody:
> In general what are developers expected to do with failed test
> reports? Is the expectation that the error message should give all
> the information necessary to identify the bug?

The developers should either:
- fix the code
- fix the test

:-)

I personally dislike when the only thing I see on the console is a
"AssertionFailedError" with no other indication (like with AssertTrue,
AssertFalse, fail()...). That's the reason why I have some specialized assert
classes (available in the JUnit-addons library).

> We are testing methods that take xml Strings as parameters and return
> xml. It would be nice to see what was passed in and what was returned
> if anything .. even when something like a NullPointerException is
> failing the test.

you can check xmlunit (never used). In the JUnit-addons cvs sandbox module,
there are some DomAssert classes that you can try. They are not quite finished
yet but you're welcome to contribute.

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir R. Bossicard
